item.title: RT Jo Kristian Bergum: The retriever abstraction in @LangChainAI is üî• Super easy to define custom retrievers, like in this example where we demonst...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJo Kristian Bergum
The retriever abstraction in @LangChainAI is üî•

Super easy to define custom retrievers, like in this example where we demonstrate user level sharding with Vespa streaming mode!


Harrison Chase:‚ÄÇA great article by @jobergum

@vespaengine is super powerful and has a lot of knobs that don't fit neatly into LangChain's idea of a vectorstore

This is exactly why we introduced the Retriever abstraction earlier this year - great to see how easy it is to implement a custom one
item.author: LangChain

@vespaengine is super powerful and has a lot of knobs that don't fit neatly into LangChain's idea of a vectorstore

This is exactly why we introduced the Retriever abstraction earlier this year - great to see how easy it is to implement a custom one


LangChain:‚ÄÇ‚ö°Ô∏èTurbocharge RAG with LangChain and Vespa Streaming Mode for Sharded Data

@vespaengine's streaming search solution enables you to efficiently search over sharded data - perfect for when you want to store data grouped by user id

@jobergum wrote a great article (complete with‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1734252293233791195

item.title: RT Peter Boshard Olson: Clear explanation from @LangChainAI's @hwchase17: There are 4 main ways to give an AI app background info: 1. Instruction prom...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇPeter Boshard Olson
Clear explanation from @LangChainAI's @hwchase17:

There are 4 main ways to give an AI app background info:
1. Instruction prompting
2. Few-shot examples
3. RAG
4. Fine-tuning

It hadn't occurred to me that these are all ways of accomplishing the same broad goal. üßµ(1/2)
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Greg Kamradt: visualizing text splitting & chunking strategies ChunkViz .com I thought I remembered a tool to visualize text chunking, but I couldn...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇGreg Kamradt
visualizing text splitting & chunking strategies

ChunkViz .com

I thought I remembered a tool to visualize text chunking, but I couldn't find it, so I built one

I didn't realize it would be so visually pleasing to tinker with

4 different @LangChainAI splitters featured


Greg Kamradt:‚ÄÇI remember seeing a chunk visualizer a while back

It would highlight the chunks found in your text according to an algorithm, chunk size, overlap you specified

Can't find the link - anyone have it?

(not token visualizer, chunks)

The end result would look like this picture
